content: Popular iced coffee drinks recalledUrgent recall issued over 'contamination risk'A range of popular iced coffee drinks have been recalled over contamination fears.

Barista Bros Iced Coffee products were pulled from supermarket shelves on Wednesday after an urgent recall was issued by Coca-Cola Europacific Partners. The recalled drinks have a 'best before' date of September 30, 2023 and onward, with both the 500ml and 700ml bottles affected. The recall came due to a potential packaging failure which could lead to a possible contamination risk. Food products that have been spoiled may cause illness if consumed, Food Standards Australia and New Zealand confirmed.

'Food products that have been spoiled may cause illness if consumed,' the authority said. The popular beverages come in various flavours including Iced Chocolate, Mocha, Espresso and Double Espresso. Customers who have purchased an affected drink are entitled to a full refund if they return the product to the place of purchase. Any shopper seeking further information can contact Coca-Cola Europacific Partners on 1800 025 123.
